DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 1 Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of whether or not pain, other than everyday kinds of pain such as minor headaches, sprains, and toothaches, is being experienced today, using a yes or no response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._A question about whether an individual has or had pain other than everyday kinds of pain.

This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: BPI SF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today? (1)

ReferenceDocuments.name: BPI User's Guide
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the BPI's development and psychometric properties.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Throughout our lives, most of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Question Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
